paper.title: Personal computing trends and problems: an empirical study

author.org: Case Western Reserve Univ., Cleveland, Ohio
Case Western Reserve Univ., Cleveland, Ohio

paper.publisher: Society for Information Management and The Management Information Systems Research Center
paper.abstract: This article reports the findings of a field study of personal computing in 173 U.S. companies. It identifies trends over the past five years in he use of personal computing as well as the corporate MIS departmentsu0027 roles, policies, and practices with regard to personal computing. A prioritized checklist of personal computing problems shows lack of user education, lack of a company-wide perspective on the use of personal computers, and overwhelming demands on MIS departments at the top in terms of problem intensity.
